meanings.sent1: The formidability of the opponent's defense made it hard to score.
meanings.sent2: The formidability of the task ahead made her nervous.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten tried to mimic the formidability of a lion by puffing up its fur.
meanings.sent4: The formidability of the storm was evident in the howling winds and crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The formidability of the mountain was daunting, but she was determined to climb it.

meanings.definition: The state of inspiring fear or respect through being impressively large, powerful, intense, or capable.
meanings.sent1: The formidability of the dragon struck fear into the hearts of the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The formidability of the army's weapons was unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's attempt to show formidability by standing on its hind legs was comical.
meanings.sent4: The formidability of the ocean's depths reminded him of his own insignificance.
meanings.sent5: The formidability of the thunderstorm was awe-inspiring, lighting up the sky with its power.
